instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
820-00928-a with short on PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT, i was find and take out the shorted cap, now there is no short but at diode mode with good board the caps should be 1168 and its show 350-450, what can cause the problem?
thanks!

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message: Did you measure on both boards with red probe at ground?

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message: Yes i did..

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
Compare board readings in the same condition; both w/, or w/o LCD connected.
Lift D8410 and check again.

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
the same...
good board "naked" 1140
bad board "naked" (without D8410 and without the shorted cap) 450

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message: Compare the readings inverting multimeter probes too.

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
good board - no reading 
bad board - 550

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
R8431 has high ohm value, but you can test removing it.
You can completely discard U8400 in this way.

I personally bet for one of filter caps, or LCD connector.
There is a "chance" for leakage between copper layers too.

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
i was remove r8431 it give 1ohm..
i will try to take each filter out and check..the wired is..after i was disable the short it give me 1140 like the good board, and after i was put "new"filter from other board its show the 550-450

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message: it was one of the filters.. :)

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
Please, do not quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.

Check around U3750/60/70.
Inspect all BT related resistors.

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
Please, use your imagination.
Copy and paste the required text between " "...

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
i was compere  j3701 with good board
bad board --- (good board)

pp3v3_s4_wlan_sw  2.7v-(3.3V)
AP_RESET_L 3.2V (0.1v)
WLAN_JTAG_SEL 0.0V (0.1V)
WLAN_JTAG_TRST_L 0V (3.3V) BAD BOARD (GOOD BOARD)
WLAN_JTAG_TDI 2.6V (3.3V)
WLAN_JTAG_TMS 26V (3.3V)
WLAN_JTAG_TCK 0.1V (3.3V)
WLAN_UART_RX 2.8V (3.3V)
WLAN_UART_TX 1.1V (3.3V)
BT_ROM_BOOT_L 3.3V (0V) BAD BOARD (GOOD BOARD)
SMC_PME_S4_DARK_L 1V (3.3V)

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
"pp3v3_s4_wlan_sw  2.7v"
U3840 could be bad, post its voltages.
Does it overheat?

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
O.K U3840 not sit well because the reflow...
now there is 3.3v but the rest of the bad reading remains..

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight
threads.message:
"AP_RESET_L 3.2V (0.1v)"
There should be a mistake, this signal must be high normally.

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight

threads.title: 820-00928-A No backlight

You've posted many WLAN signals and voltage.
I was thinking that is the problem...

Then should be one of BT related chips.
Be sure all resistors from the area are good.
